website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a serious ratchet set by a top name in tools with impressive quality, you won't find a better pick with more pieces.
pros: Not only does this huge set contain 99 black chrome pieces including ratchets, bits, and a variety of sockets with easy-to-read laser etching, but it's backed by an impressive lifetime warranty
cons: The case isn't nearly as rugged as the tools, which also don't fit snug inside

customer_reviews.title: Great tool set at an even better value
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit concerned after reading reviews that the box itself wouldn’t hold tools, came with wrong sizes, and had holes drilled through the box. Happy to report that none of this is the case for me. Every tool came (and in the correct size), the box actually holds the tools really well, and there were no holes in the plastic. The tools themselves are oiled as they should be from the manufacturer, so just take a few minutes to wipe them down and you’re good to go. Hoping the dark finish holds up over time, but from a few tests I did on my car last night, this set seems too good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Olson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, lasting, affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fleet mechanic by trade and bought this kit to add to my mobile set. Being as most of my job is spent at the shop, I try not to invest too much into my truck set. I am however used to high quality tools (snap on, so, matco, etc) as that's all I use at work. This set has surprised me with it's durability. Ratchets are nothing special, but survived a cheater pipe to remove lugs off a truck when the tire iron would clear. As did the socket and extension. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina C.

customer_reviews.title: great set
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new ratchet set after I think my contractor walked off with mine during a bathroom remodel, or my knucklebrain memory forgot where I put it. The sockets a very well made, nice and heavy to the fell. I have not had a problem using any so far. The extension pipe was necessary to undo the bolts from my toilet. I am not sure my last set had that extension piece. I like the nice clear contrasted marking on the socket size. My last set was were etched into the socket withouth writing, and it was hard to see the sizes unless the light hit it at the right angle. Not so with these. Very clear.
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: A great set of of tools in a compact case.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this tool set. So much so that it has become my “Go To” set to grab for repair and building work. The Black Crome finish helps make the tool markings stand out and makes them easy to differentiate from other tools during the clean up phase of a project. The only improvement I would make to the set would be the addition of a set of torx bits. I’m in my seventies now and this set impressed me so much that I bought an additional set for one of my grandsons that is in college now to get his mechanical engineering degree.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Eye strain for the smaller socket sizes
customer_reviews.text: At first glance , the sockets and wrenches look great. After a closer look , the laser etchings on the sockets don’t look as if they might stand the test of time. The etchings are on the surface of the sockets and anyone who has done any work on cars can attest that the sides of the sockets are prone to get very scratch up due to rubbing against other metal parts. I’m not sure if I will keep the set just for this fact. After some moderate use, will you be able tell what the smaller socket sizes are ???
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set as a start up kit before I could afford a more expensive set, and guess what, I haven't bought another set yet I've had this set close to 5 years with use and abuse done to them from day one. They've been covered in oil, grease, diff fluid and the engraving is still there.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo R.

customer_reviews.title: Greasy already?
customer_reviews.text: Good looking tools . Received them and all of the sockets were out of place . Also some of them look to have been used and are greasy as if someone has gotten oil on them. I ordered it new so not sure why they came like this .
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: When the item arrived it was all loose in the box. I had to find where all of the pieces went and some spots no longer hold the tools in place. it was also missing one of the sockets. the rest of the tools seem to be ok, and i am sure i will get by without the missing piece, but still... when you buy something you expect to get all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Remmick

customer_reviews.title: Can't do better than STANLEY!
customer_reviews.text: The beautiful black chrome finish sets them apart from everyone else's chrome tools so's there's no doubt about who they belong to. They work great and they are STANLEY quality at its best. I bought the 69 piece set last year for use in my garage and decided to get the 99 piece for work.
customer_reviews.author: I'm just saying

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a job that wasn't able to be completed with this set. I specifically wanted something with a carrying case as I move a lot and things just seems to get "lost" in the move. This has been moved twice since I bought it and everything is still there. I also wanted black, because I'm so edgy it hurts. Na, not really, but I wanted to be able to distinguish my crappier bits from this set. If I had one gripe about this kit it's because some of the sockets are a pain in the butt to get out and put back in.
customer_reviews.author: Bartley Henriques

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: They are sockets and wrenches, not much to go wrong with them. So far so good no broken tools and I have used them to fix a fair amount of automotive stuff. They feel heavy and good quality in the hand which is nice when you're pulling down on axle bolt. I have had cheap sets before and they normally core out sockets which I don't think is going to a problem with this set. Overall very happy! !
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: decent set, but...
customer_reviews.text: The set is a great little set to start off with or carry in your car... but after some use or just riding around in the case, the size label on the side of the tools start to rub off. Sure they save on engraving and pass some of those savings along to the customer, but if the customer can not make out what socket they are using... a 5 minute job turns into 6, 7... Just be forewarned that the labels are going to rub off and are hard to see to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Bayard

customer_reviews.title: Very solid built tools
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first socket set to be working on my car & around the house. They feel very solid & they work as expected. It's a very complete socket set as it includes both metric & SAE without skipping any sizes. If you're looking for a complete set of wrenches you will have to invest on a separate wrench set. I've seen people complain about the case not holding some pieces in place, but mine holds all of them & they fit tightly. Even then, tgats just being too picky. At the end, this I great first set, you can't go wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: JanellC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, Dark, Strong. No regrets with these.
customer_reviews.text: Received the tools very fast, packaged extremely well. Everyone else only seems to dwell only on the case for the tools however ive had no issues so far. For the tools them selves, man are these great for the cost! Have replaced my sparkplugs, done oil changes on my vehicle and significant others vehicle, and brakes on the two as well. The black chrome finish looks amazing with the lazer etched numbers. All the components (heads, ratchets, extensions) feel well made, clean, and sturdy. No complaints at all. None. Not even with the case. Worst scenario you take some bubble wrap and put it in there. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Not the Stanley I know...
customer_reviews.text: Main issue, 3/8 ratchet was in pieces in the box when I got it. I was unable to locate screws or spring, so I couldn't even put it back together. Socket set without a ratchet is basically useless. Also, sizes appear to be painted on, and some are already nearly impossible to read. Case is poorly made, and 2 wrenches along with 4 sockets, fall out while trying to close it. I'll be returning this as soon as I return home.
customer_reviews.author: Older-n-Dirt

customer_reviews.title: Bits are good quality with good legible sizing printed on them
customer_reviews.text: Case doesn't "snap-in" the bits so they fall out once closed. This is a pain due to my OCD of having them sit in the case correctly (with bit size displayed forward). The pieces fall out once the case is closed or while trying to close. Bits are good quality with good legible sizing printed on them. The socket and crescent wrenches are standard and easy to hold/use. Biggest disappointment is the case.
customer_reviews.author: J. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool set
customer_reviews.text: I used a friend set then ordered one for myself very durable set that has a lot of sockets you need short and long . Seemed like the delivery service threw my box because a couple tools were not in the correct space but very useful tool set
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth mack

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great
customer_reviews.text: This is my first set i got myself and I've already used it to replace a lot of things on my jeep.. other then a few specific sockets this has all you need to start out... the packaging it came in wasn't that great..i needed a screw driver to take the plastic cover off... plastic cover can be easily ripped off
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Ward

customer_reviews.title: ... the size labels on the smaller pieces aren't the best quality and can be hard to read but the ...
customer_reviews.text: some of the size labels on the smaller pieces aren't the best quality and can be hard to read but the larger socket heads have nice large labels and easy to read for us older people who don't always have our reading glasses available. Otherwise I would give it a 5 star if you would have put bigger size labels on the smaller pieces even if it takes up most of the socket.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Good product with a good finish.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and fairly complete set. Only downside is how well the sockets fit. It can be fairly difficult to remove them from the case from time to time. While I say this is a down side I’m happy to deal with it rather than a bunch of loose sockets rolling around.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: OK starter set
customer_reviews.text: The 3/8th ratchet broke after 2nd use. A little screw came off from the back, it fell off when I was using it on my car. The screw is super tiny and I almost couldn't find it. Screwed it back on and it works "OK". The socket are a bit hard to take off and others are just too loose and they rattle around the case. Wish it had 3/4" and a 18mm for the wrench side.
customer_reviews.author: omv421

customer_reviews.title: Buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Etchings denoting socket sizes could have been more clear, brighter. But set it very nice, very compact and not filled with a bunch of useless stuff.. Like 10 million allen wrenches and screwdriver bits. A socket and wrench set is what you get here, hands down. And the black chrome is attractive. Very pleased with my set. A great set to have at a minimum, nothing less.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Broken Rachet
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tool set for about two months and have used it 5-10 times to try to fix part of my car. The smaller rachet is already broken, as it is only able to go in one direction! I am unable to switch it to the other direction! I am very disappointed that the tool broke so quickly. (First picture is at the position it works. Second picture is how far the direction switching lever will go. Video shows that I am unable to move it past the middle.) Otherwise, the set is nice. Some of the sockets are hard for me to get out...but that's better than them being too loose! The black chrome finish is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great Set!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade from a smaller older system and use when servicing my boat engine. Have used it for several other projects already! Would definitely recommend this to others! Haven't run across a piece I needed that wasn't include in this set!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent set of tools for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent set of tools for the money. I like the polished black oxide finish and the markings on the sockets are easy to read gold color. The wrenches are super thin, allowing you to get into tight spots where thicker wrenches won't go. Some of my friends call them chicy looking, but as far as I can tell, they're every bit as strong as regular wrenches. I love 'em.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a complete set of sockets and this set worked just right. It has all the stuff I'll need going forward and is a great compliment to my current tool collection. Yea, OK, I don't collect tools I use them, and this set is a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: not a geek

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but Too Expensive For What You Get
customer_reviews.text: This set seems decent. As everyone else states the case is worthless and it is missing an important ratchet size. Also, some of the size markings on my tools are scuffed or blurred. Not really a premium set worth the price. Craftsman would be a better bet.
customer_reviews.author: usafpj

customer_reviews.title: Probably a good deal if you want lots of sockets and some ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a tool set for a homeowner that wants volume over quality. Probably a good deal if you want lots of sockets and some wrenches for a low price, but the socket sizes are painted on and some already illegible. The design of the socket holder is poor and the sockets fall all over the place. I sent it back and bought sockets from Williams that are much better quality and design.
customer_reviews.author: Oakland Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought that it would be
customer_reviews.text: Stanley tools are usually a good brand but, on this set of tools the 1/4" ratchet was stiff right out of the box then seized after the first use. The plastic case will not hold the sockets in place when closed. when opened, (even slowly) sockets fall out. Minor but aggravating. I would have expected this from a cheap, no name set of tools not Stanley.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Segal

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tool set to keep in our motorhome in the event of an emergency. We also take our boat with us when we travel. This is the perfect little toolbox to bring along. It has everything we would need for a quick repair if needed. My husband is very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rob G.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Product came coated in grease, sockets falling out, and screws driven into the case.
customer_reviews.author: Catch

customer_reviews.title: Black all over
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage! These are great if you want black all over your hands, the floor, the case and anywhere else the tools happen to touch. On top of that, the plastic case is way too flimsy for the weight of the painted tools. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: T.Tech

customer_reviews.title: good tools. As is typical with these type sets
customer_reviews.text: good tools. As is typical with these type sets, the case doesn't hold stuff well and they flop around. Wish someone would fix that problem, but it seem to be the same with all makers.
customer_reviews.author: dj51florida

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Starter Set.
customer_reviews.text: Found it at a good price and it is a good set for people that don't have any or need a spare set. It feels that is more Auto oriented since it has the spark plug sockets. Slight warning, mine came a bit messed up because of all the movement it has in shipping so they might be all over the place. consider opening carefully. They come a bit oily but its probably to protect them from the elements. Other than that is a really good set.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Classy hand tools
customer_reviews.text: Stanley does tools right. This is durability with a touch of class. This is the largest of my three black sets. No complaints. Keep ‘em close—theives love black chrome.
customer_reviews.author: electroman

customer_reviews.title: So make sure you get nice full set of wrenches
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had more wrench sizes; or didn't have wrenches at all, and had more sockets. I just don't understand instrument sets with missing sizes! Do it properly or don't do it at all... So make sure you get nice full set of wrenches, and also 1/2" sockets for your breaker bar/impact gun (Tacklife recommended)
customer_reviews.author: Arman Amirzhan

customer_reviews.title: Nice tools, shoddy case
customer_reviews.text: I really like the tools that come with this set (although I would have preferred stamped chromed sockets). The only issue I have is the case is pretty useless when it comes to keeping things in place. Still worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Great tool set
customer_reviews.text: Great tool set. What keeps me from giving it 5 stars is that some of the sockets don't hold in their places and will fall out when I go to close it. It seems to happen on just one side for me, so I have to be mindful to close it by one side.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: I rarely need anything more than this assortment This sturdy case holds the tools well and keeps them organized
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for everyday jobs. This assortment is perfect for a wide range of work. I tote this around to whatever I am working on. I rarely need anything more than this assortment This sturdy case holds the tools well and keeps them organized.
customer_reviews.author: Durwardrm

customer_reviews.title: Great tool set and manageable carrying case.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool set. Just enough tools to get a lot of mechanical work done on cars with relatively thin case to put it on truck without taking up much space. Watch price fluctuation they can fall sub 60.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SOCKET SET!!! A+++++++++++
customer_reviews.text: Awesome socket set! Has everything you need to do repairs, installs, and maintenance. Black chrome looks great and is sturdy. Installed my own audio system (big 3 etc) and oil change so far with this. Can't go wrong, only thing is the sockets are a bit loose in the case so when you shut and open do so .. slowly . HIGHLY RECCOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent tool set
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent tool set. The ratcheting mechanisms feel weird on the ratchets but maybe because they're new. Not sure whether the finish is a chrome or powdercoat, but no matter to me. They work fine. They look really nice and the sizes are easily visible on the wrenches and sockets. I am keeping this set in my jeep and for the money, I have no regrets. Go ahead and price a comparable set like this. It was a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S. Bonito

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality but OK
customer_reviews.text: 1. Not suitable for impact drivers. 2. Low quality Numbers etching for SAE very hard to read for some of the Sockets. 3. Incorrect Sockets in Sets - instead of 7/8 I got duplicate 13/16, Since I saw this complaint in other reviews as well , I assume it is a repeating Low QA in assembly/packaging . It does what it suppose to do but I can not yet tell if this set will serve for the long run
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: "ok" tool set
customer_reviews.text: The set I received was all over the place from packaging. Some sockets are dirty and the etching is hard to read. I won't be using this set for any strenuous jobs so I hope they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Gio. Quiroga

customer_reviews.title: Large numbering disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for the large numbering but was so disappointed when some sockets are just barely readable. Otherwise a good tool set just don't order it for the large numbering because you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J Mar

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stanley set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift, it came in really nice. I was afraid because of the reviews but I checked everything and was good. Sorry I don’t have pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: The Stanley name has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this socket set and use it to fix nieces wheelchair and also my car I dropped a socket wrench both of them once and they stopped working grinding and would not operate correctly what a terrible waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: These is a very nice set of tools
customer_reviews.text: These is a very nice set of tools, I told myself that I was going to purchase tools once a week, to make my home garage toolbox complete. So you might see my other reviews on those items too. I love shopping on Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good valued :D
customer_reviews.text: This will be my premium set of tools for very special projects/repairs :D Yes, the packaging and the screws holding the transparent plastic is not the best thing, but C'MON! You can't ask more for that price. It is very good valued. The black finish looks great! And case looks pro! I love the whole thing. The whole set will require cleaning right out of the box, since it comes covered with some sort of sticky grease.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Great set, great package delivery. Everything was in the package like it was listed. Would definitely buy another set.
customer_reviews.author: Danny calixto

customer_reviews.title: Good item.
customer_reviews.text: Good item & I purcased cheaper when the black friday. (thanks gift card.) But I open the case, driver bit and some ratchet(10mm, 3/8mm) is leave the case. So I review 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ho C.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for price
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking set of tools. I wont go with black again, black scratches off from heavy wear. Doesn't include a full wrench set. Ratchet broke the first use, Stanley sent me a new one within days. Good deal for price
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Stanley 92-839 Black Chrome and Laser Etched Socket Set, 99-Piece
customer_reviews.text: I like this set. It was hard to find elsewhere and if so it was really expensive. Due to Covid-19 my order was delayed but other than that no worries. I just bought it because it's better to have it then need it and for the price for this set it was a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Jovel

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice set of tools
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set of tools. They work well and happen to look good, too. I'm only giving it four stars for two reasons. First, all the sockets seem to have a light coat of oil, which makes working with them annoying. Second, the product came in a plastic display enclosure that required I remove approximately 20 screws. That was really obnoxious. But once you get past those annoyances, these are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good set, coworkers kept trying to steal
customer_reviews.text: Same set that i used to use when i worked in metal fab/final production. Good set, coworkers kept trying to steal. Power coat is nice, laser etching held up well. As far as i know, the old set is still in use at the plant. New set, is the same - i do not use large air impacts with these sockets.
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: Using these all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after it was recommended by a DIY mechanic I respect. This has been a great set of tools that I use all the time. Sometimes the pieces pop out of the cheap case that holds all the attachments, but not to where it's a problem. The ability to use different sockets and sizes is a lifesaver for working on my car!
customer_reviews.author: Scottn59c

customer_reviews.title: Yep its a socket set
customer_reviews.text: I use mine alot but I'm not a mechanic so I cant speak for daily use. Havent had any sockets strip out or any of the wrenches bend. It's another socket set, I honestly bought this particular one because I thought the black looked cool
customer_reviews.author: Triple c

customer_reviews.title: Good quality set in a compact carry case.
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact tool set with good quality components. I wanted something to carry in the car or truck - fits the bill. Nice button on ratchets to release the sockets or extensions. wide variety of tools. Only issue was that a couple of the small crescent wrenches don't stick in the case so you have to be careful closing it so they don't fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tool set for a son !
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tool set. I bought this for my son on his 21st birthday. What guy wouldn't love this especially if it is from his father.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lee

customer_reviews.title: Feels like quality Love the easy to read markings Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Feels like quality Love the easy to read markings Cons: Case doesn't quite hold the sockets tight enough - A couple sockets always try to escape when I open it. (my previous Stanley set held on too tight - had to pry sockets out with screwdriver every time.) The metric combo wrenches are 10,13,14,15,17. I wish they'd included a 12mm instead of the 13mm because a 1/2 wrench usually works interchangeably as a 13mm.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Great product...except for case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set because it had all the sockets and wrenches I needed in one case. Additionally, very few people have black socket sets and it makes it easy to identify my tools on the job site. The one major complaint I have is the sockets falling out of their places when you open the case. It's not just one or two, but nearly half.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Like the black chrome edition and good quality still haven’t broken anything yet and I’ve had it for a long time now, this is a really late review
customer_reviews.author: VangVang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wrench and socket set
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wrench and socket set! Treated myself to these for Christmas since they were on sale. Very well made and would definitely recommend to any handyman or do-it-your-selfer. Well worth the full price.
customer_reviews.author: mjg333

customer_reviews.title: Will recommend Great set
customer_reviews.text: Love this set easy to find what your looking for an the quality is great haven't had an issue yet. Will recommend to friends an family for the price
customer_reviews.author: Nate rensland

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about this set. It have so much with it. The case itself is durable and the tools have held up through replacing and fixing so many things.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Henry

customer_reviews.title: Weak plactic holder
customer_reviews.text: The plastic tabs that hold the sockets wore out after a dozen uses causing the sockets to fall out of there holder. Not good for that much money. I would not buy this product for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Henson

customer_reviews.title: Good set I only wish it also had the universal ...
customer_reviews.text: Good set I only wish it also had the universal set inside it. It feel like the double every thing inside it to make it looks like a bigger set And I don't think it is the best quality but it will do the job
customer_reviews.author: yaniv zinger

customer_reviews.title: It's a great set to keep around and convient to have if ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this set for 3 years and never had a problem with them. I also colored in the numbers in my case to make them pop out more. I've added before and after pictures. It's a great set to keep around and convient to have if your working on the car so you don't have to get up and keep going in the garage to get another socket.
customer_reviews.author: tony71110

customer_reviews.title: NO 19mm DEEP SOCKET!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this set in the mail today and was immediately not happy the second I opened it. Not only is it cheap but the painted numbers and black chrome are already wearing off!! The biggest disappointment though, is that when looking at the product before purchasing there was a 19mm deep socket included in the picture... there’s not one in there now. This was a MUST for me since I drive a Subaru and do my own maintenance. Honestly, the only reason I chose this set in specific was because it included that socket, but now I have a 13/16 deep socket I have no use for. All you import owners out there beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Grease 🤔
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool set It would be best to get a dark color rag and wipe the lubrication off of all the sockets and tools in the box because just like the other reviewers had indicated that the tools were greasy (Lubrication) If you dnt it will leave yur hands black 🤔🤔but who knows a mechanic whu has clean hands afta doing work on a vehicle without wearing gloves
customer_reviews.author: Copycat

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had for a year and I can’t complain, for a first tool set I recommend. They have mostly all the sizes you’ll need as a beginner. And they don’t skip sizes in the sockets. Only thing I recommend would be getting an other wrench set with this because the wrench set this box bring don’t range very far. Other then that I recommend getting this set.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: tools look good, but I will update my review after 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: tools looks good, but I will update my review after 6 months. The box came with is really bad. When I opened the tool box, most of the tools fell off. I gave 2 two stars before. After a year later i came back to review them again. Every time i open the tool box, all the tools fall out!
customer_reviews.author: Hr

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This will hold for years to come. Purchased this to make automotive repairs on my Honda vehicles. Nice color and polished finish. Smooth operation too.
customer_reviews.author: JeanG

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool box. Great job STANTLEY nothing but great, the black colors and all the tools your going to need in a box. Wish I could free tools from you guys. lol Great buy if your car guy or just need something around the garage for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Paco Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Interesting texture.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this kit to my son. The grip texture is wild feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Tim collins

customer_reviews.title: Love this toolset
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent toolset for the price. All the tools are of good quality, the black finish is very nice, and the carrying case is great. The only complaint I have is the ratchets are pretty small do you can't get very good leverage. You either need to use a cheater bar on the end of the ratchet or a longer ratchet/breaker bar for tougher job.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Martin

customer_reviews.title: This is what my hand looked like after about 5 minutes of handling these tools
customer_reviews.text: "Black chrome".... I'm skeptical. This is what my hand looked like after about 5 minutes of handling these tools. About an hour with some solvent cleaned them up pretty well, but it took some work. Most pieces are quite shiny now, but a few are notably dull... maybe produced in a different batch?? Mechanically, they're fine, but just messy to use out of the box. I recommend wearing gloves anytime you use these.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality all around
customer_reviews.text: This set was not what I was expecting, sockets don't fit right in case everytime you open severAL of them fall out , wrench don't have good points on them
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tools so far
customer_reviews.text: Been working on my car with these and a torque bar rated for 20-100 ft lbs and couldn't be happier. There were about 20 screws to undo to get access to the poorly made case, so enjoy that, but the tools are great quality; not some janky European brand by the name of Sencys who also manufactures a plethora of non-tool related products (in a tool kit I tried by Sencys, I STRIPPED a screwdriver putting together an IKEA TABLE! CHEAP!).
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Love the set, 1/4" ratchet fell to pieces after about 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: 1/4" ratchet came to pieces while removing a dead pedal in my Jeep Rubicon. No excessive torque. The screws that hold the guts of the ratchet together came loose and all parts scattered. One securing screw MIA
customer_reviews.author: David M  Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for working on car and around the house stuff, now my son wants a set :-). Be sure to squeeze all attachments back to their areas, because yes they can come loose. Overall I like the color easy labeling and use if these tools. Great price. Used them to take door panel off my car to fix window :-)
customer_reviews.author: sprtsgirl

customer_reviews.title: Clean solid set.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set for car. Comes in handy when things go wrong. This makes things right.
customer_reviews.author: Billsreview

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good set. Not the best or second or third best but at $57 it's very good Probably better than the 'new' (foreign sourced) craftsman. These are the same as Dewalt and Proto.
customer_reviews.author: gm0n

customer_reviews.title: The case could be better designed for holding the tools
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool set. The case could be better designed for holding the tools. Other than this reality the purchase has been a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tool box
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift. Everything stays in place except one item. Overall good buy, has many tools and compared to many other tool boxes like this the tools stay in place. The black looks nice and the locks are secure.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: OK but now a professional grade
customer_reviews.text: The places where you put the sockets are not secure enough the Sockets fall out almost immediately
customer_reviews.author: Big E

customer_reviews.title: Sockets missing
customer_reviews.text: I am very unsatisfied with this product. I open the socket set and there are sockets missing. I'm missing a 1/4" drive short 7/16" socket and a 3/8" drive short 10mm. I would like the items sent to me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came missing wrench
customer_reviews.text: Came missing the 1/2" box wrench. Thankfully Amazon gave me credit to go out and purchase a replacement. Otherwise looks like a pretty all-encompassing socket/screwdriver set.
customer_reviews.author: A. A. Zaiken

customer_reviews.title: I love this socket set!
customer_reviews.text: It is beautiful and complete for my needs. I have not needed a socket that was not in this box. So far, I have fixed; my lawnmower, scooter, and car with the greatest of ease. I do have a problem with the sockets falling out of their homes that I fixed with a strip of old bike tire stretched across the row then tacked on the sides. Everyone that sees my socket set asks about it and where I got it.
customer_reviews.author: TracySwingKid

customer_reviews.title: Using this for basic car maintenance and house work.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice!! It stays in place in the carrying case. Haven't tried using them yet. Using these for minor car and house work. Should do the job just fine. Like the Black Chrome finish.
customer_reviews.author: E.S. SF

customer_reviews.title: This fits the bill.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wrench set to keep on my service truck. The snug case keeps everything in place, but still have easy access. The markings are easy to read, no squinting when in direct sunlight. I wouldn't buy them to use daily as a mechanic, but for occasional use - they're hard to beat. Best part about it is they didn't include any junky gizmo tools to inflate the tool count.
customer_reviews.author: Dean's

customer_reviews.title: Nice tools.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. We keep this in the car, perfect for that purpose. Make sure the sizes you need are included before buying though.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for someone who just needs a basic set of tools.
customer_reviews.author: Sovandara Chan

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool set
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this toolset in 2017. Everything worked normally till I beat the 3/8 ratchet to death one day. It took a good beating before it started to fail. If you're thinking about how long this tool set will last you. It will last for years as long as you don't literally beat your tools with a hammer. Buy this tool set because its affordable and will last you for your normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Certified YouTube Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Good quality set
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool set. Good variety of sizes and pretty nice little case. They came with a manufacturing oil on them making them a little sticky but not an issue. Size makes it easy to carry in your truck or car. We have one is each of our company vehicals.
customer_reviews.author: Jiah Quayle

customer_reviews.title: The material is of great quality, seems solid and there is about everything ...
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a present for father's day. It arrived quickly. The material is of great quality, seems solid and there is about everything you would need for a repair in there.
customer_reviews.author: katyana vertpre

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: some peices dont hold in place when transporting box. pieces arent made for air tools
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Merza

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - get what you pay
customer_reviews.text: I feel this tool set is good for people that do some maintenance on their vehicle. It may not put up with the big jobs, but I know youtuber ChrisFix used it for some big jobs and highly recommended it. Th plastic is my only complaint, it does seem cheap, but hold the tools in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comes with free screws
customer_reviews.text: It feels nice to hold and I haven't been able to break anything. Looks nice too. The plastic cover was screwed in place and needed my drill to undo about 16 screws.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Parts will break
customer_reviews.text: 1/4 socket wrench blew apart. Like others have stated....wasnt torqing hard when the 2 screws holding it all together popped out. Also busted the 1/4 extension while torqing lug nuts. Expected more from this set seeing as my home depot 60$ husky set has seen alot more abuse and is still intact
customer_reviews.author: Dsav6

product_meta.title: Stanley 92-839 Black Chrome and Laser Etched Socket Set, 99-Piece
product_meta.description:
Black-backed electric lawn & garden Equipment releases zero emissions in your yd, helping to reduce your carbon footprint this 250 mph blower blows through leaves & debris with ease 50% quieter* for less noise during blowing high impact metal Fan prevents clogging when mulching, while grinding to 16 bags of mulch down to one disposable leaf bag system for easy, no hassle leaf disposal includes 2 disposable bags: Simply tie & toss for quick, easy cleanup 2 Speed selections for flower beds & powerful enough for matted leaves the 12 amp motor 3-in-1 blower, vacuum, & mulcher keeps the yd neat & tidy Easily change between vacuum & blower. Built-in cord retainer keeps the extension in place & plugged in for uninterrupted use *maximum noise level compared to Black & Decker model LH4500 utilizing en ISO 3744 sound measurement test procedure

AMAZON.COM
The Stanley 82-839 Black Chrome and Laser Etched Socket Set includes 99 pieces that meet or exceed the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) specifications for combination wrenches, sockets, and ratchets. The laser etched sockets provide hi-visibility markings, making it easier to read compared to standard marked sockets. Black chrome offers a sharper appearance and better corrosion resistance when compared to regular chrome sockets. A 2-piece cases allow for lid removal and enable the back case to be used as a drawer tray. An easy reassemble of the lid to the case provides for convenient tool storage and travel.

 



Versatile, durable, and designed to accomplish tasks efficiently. 

Designed to meet high standards for quality and performance. See a video for Stanley Tool Sets. About Stanley Sockets and Ratchets
Stanley sockets feature the proprietary Max-Drive design, a unique radius corner design which provides 15 percent more torque, making it easy to tighten fasteners and simplifies the turning of rounded corners. This technology helps reduce fastener wear without contact on the outer 5 percent of the fastener, so fasteners last longer. This helps reduce slipping on frozen or rusted fasteners. Stanley sockets are manufactured worldwide with high alloy steel and heat treated for performance. Stanley ratchets and accessories are designed to meet or exceed ANSI specifications. All are forged from high-quality steel and finished in high-polish chrome. Selected Stanley high-torque ratchets have a Quick Release mechanism for one-handed use. Sockets and extensions remain locked onto the drive until disengaged with an easy-to-reach, low-profile quick-release button. Stanley Pear Head Ratchets have a slim profile and a small 7-degree arc-swing for accessing hard to reach fasteners. 


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Stanley Works, originally a bolt and door hardware manufacturing company located in New Britain, Connecticut; was founded in 1843 by Frederick T. Stanley. A few years later, in 1857, Frederick’s cousin, Henry Stanley, founded The Stanley Rule and Level Company. In 1920, The Rule and Level Company merged with The Stanley Works and would go on to become it’s famous Hand Tools Division. Over the years, The Stanley Works has produced some of the most innovative and useful tools ever made. Among these tools are the Bailey Plane, the Surform shaper, the PowerLock tape rule and most recently the FatMax line of products. Today, more than ever, Stanley continues to be an industry leader in tool innovation. In 2001, Stanley introduced more than 100 new products, bringing to 400 the number of new products introduced in the past four years. As a direct result of Stanley’s commitment to excellence, Stanley was awarded the Prestigious Golden Hammer Award, presented for New Product Innovation in both 2000 and 2001.

See more

Black chrome offers sharper appearance and better Slip Resistant,corrosion resistance
